isis.stitle: TSI 90-16-07 - Installation, Roof Air Deflector and Roof Air Deflector Extension

subjectgroup.subject: Installation, Roof Air Deflector and Roof Air Deflector Extension

geninfo.para: This TSI replaces the 9300/9400 Series information in TSI-89-16-1 dated August, 1989. Discard TSI-89-16-1.

warning.para: Do not attempt installation while muffler and tail pipe are hot. Contact with hot surfaces can cause serious personal injuries. This installation requires personnel to work on roof of vehicle or on ladders. Extra care must be taken. Falling from heights can cause serious personal injuries.

caution.para: Slings dangling from lifting device can snag air deflector or side deflector extension while vehicle is being driven away after assembly has been completed, and can cause extensive vehicle damage.
Bolts forced into misaligned holes will induce stress in material and can cause extensive material damage. Redrill any set of misaligned holes before inserting bolt.
Do not overtighten fasteners. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

note.para: Two people are needed to complete this installation. Air deflector extensions are assembled to air deflector before placing on vehicle. To avoid distorting deflector and extension panels, install each bolt with washers and nut as each hole is drilled. Install bolts that will be visible so that heads are on finished side of deflector or extensions.

partsinfo.para: Roof protection must be available. It can be made from a remnant of indoor-outdoor carpeting, or Saf-Tred stair tread material or other material that will protect paint from damage and provide non-slip surface. Refer to Figure 1.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Proper Use Of Roof Protective Covering

partsinfo.para: A special air deflector lifting sling can be made from lightweight chain, rubber hose, bolts and nuts, plus small angle stock. Refer to Figure 2for details.

item.para: Lifting device to hold 300 pounds (Accolift® hand chain hoist, #1320010, 1/20-ton maximum capacity, or equivalent) located so as to allow vehicle and deflector to pass underneath.
Two Visegrip® pliers, VP11SP, or equivalent.
One three-foot stepladder with padded top edge.
Padded frame stand. Refer to Figure 3.

calloutgroup.callout1: A. PROTECTIVE COVER (CLOTH AND TAPE, FOR EXAMPLE)

svcproc.title: INSTALLATION: CAB ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR ASSEMBLY - ALL MODELS
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 4 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Remove air horns from roof brackets on left and right sides if equipped.
Put cab roof air deflector (Item 1) on blocks high enough to permit attachment of lifting sling to bottom. Attach lifting sling to air deflector.

If the vehicle is equipped with aerodynamic panels but does not have sleeper box cut slots in the upper corners of the roof air deflector, refer to Cab Roof Air Deflector Assembly - Models Without Sleeper Box.
With help from another person, guide air deflector into position on cab roof.
Align pre-drilled holes in air deflector with front roof mounting brackets (Item 2) and rear mounting brackets (Item 4). Brackets must be inside deflector.
Using roof brackets (Item 2 and 4) as templates and a 11/32 inch diameter bit, back-drill 3 holes in air deflector at centers of slots in roof brackets.

caution.para: The cab or sleeper roof may be damaged if excessive weight is placed on it. To avoid causing damage, minimize body contact with the roof and do not stand on it. Use a ladder resting on the deck plate and against the back panel to gain access. Always protect cab paint from damage and make sure another person holds the ladder secure while in use.

step1.para: Attach air deflector to brackets (Items 2 and 4) with fasteners. Use ladders to gain access to bolts from outside. Do not tighten nuts until all fasteners for the brackets are assembled.
Align air deflector with roof, then with the help of another person, tighten all nuts until snug.
If equipped, position air horns through openings in deflector and re-install.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Cab Roof Air Deflector Installation (42 Inch Shown, 60 Inch Similar)

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH BOLT W/FLAT WASHERS, SPECIAL FLAT WASHER AND LOCKNUT

svcproc.title: INSTALLATION: CAB ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR EXTENSION ASSEMBLY - MODELS WITHOUT SLEEPER BOX

step1.para: Unpack roof deflector extensions and hardware. Paint the extensions following directions in PAINT and REFINISHING section of the Service Manual.

note.para: The roof air deflector must have two slots cut out of each upper corner to allow for attachment of the extension angles.

step1.para: Use the following procedure to cut slots in corners:

step2.para: Make two templates using the pattern in Figure 5.
Align the templates at each corner with the top of each template positioned 27-1/2 inches from the deflector center line ( Figure 6).
Cut out slots in the air deflector with a suitable saw, then file and paint rough edges.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Pattern For Template To Cut Slots Into Air Deflector
Figure 6. Positioning The Template Onto The Air Deflector

step1.para: Mark hole locations on the air deflector as shown in Figure 6. Using a 11/32 inch diameter drill bit, backdrill four holes in the air deflector for attachment of extension angles (Item 24, Figure 6).

Using clamping tools, attach each extension angle to the air deflector. Fasten the angles to the deflector with four 5/16-18 x 1.0 inch hex head bolts, flat washers, and locknuts. Tighten all fasteners until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Remove the rear most fastener from each cab roof rear mounting bracket (Item 4, Figure 4).
Using clamping tools, attach the left and right roof air deflector side extensions (Item 25, Figure 7) to the extension angles (Item 24) and cab side extension channels (Item 26).

figure.caption: Figure 7. Attachment Of Side Extensions To Air Deflector

step1.para: Using the deflector extensions as templates and a 11/32 inch drill bit drill three holes into each side of the roof air deflector. Using the extension angles as templates and the same drill bit, drill two holes in each side extension. Fasten the side extensions to the extension angles and air deflector with 5/16-18 x 1.0 inch hex head bolts, flat washers, and locknuts (two washers for each bolt). Fasten the bottom of each side extension to the roof deflector using the rear mounting bracket fasteners removed in Step 5. DO NOT TIGHTEN.
Fasten the roof air deflector extensions to the cab side extension channels (Item 27) with 5/16-18 x 1.0 inch bolts, flat washers and locknuts (two washers for each bolt). DO NOT TIGHTEN.
Tighten all fasteners from Steps 7 and 8 until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Remove all clamping tools.
Slide extension moldings (Item 28, Figure 8) into the molding brackets at the rear of the deflector extensions. Lubricate if necessary using foamy glass cleaner or a similar product.
Locate and mark points on molding brackets at 8 inches from the bottom for the lower hole and 34 inches from the bottom for the upper hole. Fasten with self drilling screws (Item 29).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Attachment Of Extension Moldings To Side Extension

svcproc.title: INSTALLATION: CAB ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR EXTENSION ASSEMBLY - MODELS WITH 42 OR 60 INCH SLEEPER BOX

step1.para: Unpack side and center extensions (Items 7 and 16, Figure 9). Also unpack extension extenders (Item 9) if working on 9400 with 60 inch sleeper model. Paint all panels following directions in PAINT and REFINISHING section of the Service Manual.

calloutgroup.callout1: 14. REAR (42 INCH BBC) OR INTERMEDIATE (60 INCH BBC) MOUNTING BRACKET

step1.para: Using Visegrip® pliers or similar tool, assemble by overlapping side and center extensions with center extension underneath, and clamp together temporarily. Panels may require trimming to fit correctly. Align uniformly with gap of 1/4 inch or less. Refer to Figure 10.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Fastener Detail - Center Extension To Side Extension

calloutgroup.callout1: 17. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH CAP SCREWS, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUTS

step1.para: Put assembly on blocks high enough (approximately 8 inches) to permit attachment of lifting sling at bottom.
Using side extensions (Item 7, Figure 9) as templates and 11/32 inch diameter bit, drill 18 holes in center extension.
Portion 7 screws (Item 17, Figure 10) in holes on each side of center extension, counting from the rear. Place two other screws in front hole on each side of center extension.
Attach rear brace mounting brackets (Item 8, Figure 10) on second and third screws, counting from the rear on each side. Secure with locknuts and tighten until snug.
Secure remaining screws with locknuts and tighten until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening can cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Remove clamping tools.
9400 with 60 inch BBC models only: Attach extension extenders to side extensions.

step2.para: Align extension extenders (Item 9, Figure 9) to side extensions (Item 7) and clamp temporarily using Visegrip® pliers or similar tool. Using extender as a template and a 11/32 inch diameter bit, drill 6 holes in each side extension.
Attach extension extenders (Item 9, Figure 9) with fasteners.

step1.para: Slide extension moldings (Item 11, Figure 11) into molding brackets (Item 12) at rear of side extensions (Item 7 - 42 inch BBC) or extension extenders (Item 9 - 9400 W/60 inch BBC). Molding flares to outside. Lubricate with foamy glass cleaner or similar product if necessary.

calloutgroup.callout1: 9. SIDE EXTENSION EXTENDER (9400 WITH 60 INCH BBC ONLY)
19. 10-16 X 1 1/4 INCH SELF DRILLING PAN HEAD SCREW

step1.para: Locate and mark points on molding brackets 2 inches and 40 inches above inside bottom surface of extension (Item 7, Figure 11) or extender (Item 9). Install screws (Item 19) through molding bracket into extension molding.
Attach lifting sling to air deflector extension assembly. With help of another person, guide assembly into position on sleeper box.

Align pre-drilled holes in deflector, extension assembly with roof mounting brackets (Item 15 and 14 only - 42 inch BBC or Items 15, 14 and 13 - 60 inch BBC, Figure 12). Brackets must be inside extension assembly. Align air deflector extension assembly with air deflector. Maintain uniform gap of 2 inches minimum between them.

figure.caption: Figure 12. Fastener Detail - Mounting Brackets To Side Extension

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 BOLT, FLAT WASHERS, SPECIAL FLAT WASHER, LOCKNUT
14. REAR (42 INCH BBC) OR INTERMEDIATE (60 INCH BBC) MOUNTING BRACKET

step1.para: Using brackets (Items 15 and 14 or 15, 14 and 13, Figure 12) as templates and a 13/32 inch diameter bit, backdrill 4 holes in each side extension (Item 7) at centers of slots on roof brackets.
Attach side extensions to brackets as shown in Figure 12. Do not tighten nuts.

Attach front braces (Item 20, Figure 13) to each side of center-side extension assembly (inside). The bolts must be in the second hole on vertical surfaces of assembly, counting from the front. Do not tighten nuts.
Raise both front braces to cross each other at their mid-points. Secure together with a 6 inch hose clamp at their mid-point . Do not tighten.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Fastener Detail - Front Cross Brace To Center Extension And Side Extension

calloutgroup.callout1: 17. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH CAP SCREW, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT
18. 5/16-18 X 1 /14 INCH BOLT, EXTERNAL/INTERNAL TOOTH LOCK WASHER, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT

step1.para: Attach rear braces (Item 10, Figure 14) to rear brace mounting brackets (Item 8) with fasteners. Raise both rear braces to cross each other at the mid-points. Secure with a 6 inch hose clamp at their mid-point. Do not tighten.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Fastener Detail - Rear Cross Brace To Deflector Bracket

calloutgroup.callout1: 17. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH CAP SCREWS, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUTS
18. 5/16-18 X 1 /14 INCH BOLT, EXTERNAL/INTERNAL TOOTH LOCK WASHER, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT

step1.para: Attach front braces (Item 20, Figure 15) to front mounting brackets (Item 15) with fasteners (Item 18). Do not tighten nuts.
Attach rear braces (Item 10, Figure 15) to the rear (42 inch BBC) or intermediate (60 inch BBC) mounting brackets (Item 14). Do not tighten nuts.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Fastener Detail - Roof Mounting Brackets To Front Or Rear Cross Braces

calloutgroup.callout1: 14. REAR (42 INCH BBC) OR INTERMEDIATE (60 INCH BBC) MOUNTING BRACKET
18 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH BOLT EXTERNAL/INTERNAL TOOTH LOCK WASHER, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: With help from another person, align deflector extension assembly with cab roof air deflector and with sleeper box roof. Maintain 2 inches minimum gap between deflector and extension.
Tighten nuts on front braces at center extension snug. Tighten hose clamps on front and rear braces until snug.
Tighten all nuts on roof mounting brackets on left and right sides to 30 ft-lbs. (46 Nm).
Inspect all other nuts for tightness. Tighten all that are loose.
Using Visegrip® pliers or similar tool, clamp left side extension extender (Item 9, Figure 16) to sleeper side extension (Item 22).
Attach extender to sleeper side extension with fasteners (Item 32, Figure 16). Tighten until snug.
Remove clamping tool

figure.caption: Figure 16. Fastener Detail - Sleeper Roof Side Extension Extender To Sleeper Side Extension

calloutgroup.callout1: 21. 5/16-18 X 1.0 INCH BOLT FLAT WASHER, LOCKNUT

step1.para: For 9400 with 60 inch BBC only:

step2.para: Attach extender race (Item 23, Figure 17) to extension extender (Item 9) with bolt, flat washers and locknut.
Position loose end in place at side extension (Item 9) and using the end as a template, backdrill a hole in the extension with an 11/32 inch drill bit.
Fasten loose end and tighten. Repeat on the other extender.

step1.para: Clear slings, remove roof platform from roof and move ladders away from vehicle before driving away.
